abstract: Anthony Réveillère (French pronunciation: ​[ɑ̃.tɔ.ni ʁe.vɛ.jɛʁ]; born 10 November 1979) is a French footballer who plays for S.S.C. Napoli in Serie A, as a right back.He spent most of his professional career with Rennes and Lyon, amassing Ligue 1 totals of 426 games and four goals over the course of 16 seasons and winning 12 major titles with the latter, including five national championships.Réveillère represented France at the 2010 World Cup and Euro 2012.

Napoli in Serie A, as a right back.He spent most of his professional career with Rennes and Lyon, amassing Ligue 1 totals of 426 games and four goals over the course of 16 seasons and winning 12 major titles with the latter, including five national championships.Réveillère represented France at the 2010 World Cup and Euro 2012.
